p: EV-A71 belongs to the genus Enterovirus within the family of Picornaviridae. It was first characterized in 1969 in California, USA [ 25] and is one of the main etiological agents of hand, foot and mouth disease (HFMD) [ 26]. Some cases of EV-A71 infections have been associated with neurological complications such as aseptic meningitis, brainstem encephalitis and acute flaccid paralysis [ 27]. In China, enteroviruses such as EV-A71 and CV-A16 have caused 7,200,092 cases of HFMD between 2008 to 2012. The mortality rate was highest among children below the age of five. It was further reported that 82,486 patients developed neurological complications and 1617 deaths were confirmed by the laboratory to be caused by EV-A71 [ 28, 29].
